name: loop
description:
Looping is a very powerful programming technique that lets you repeat a set of instructions or
display output repeatedly until one or more conditions are met. cfloop supports five types of loops.

params.name: index
params.description:
Index value. Lucee sets it to from value and increments or decrements by step value, until it equals to value.

When looping over a Struct/Collection:

- When the Item attribute is also defined, the variable assigned to the Index attribute will contain the value of the Struct's Key/Value pair (otherwise, it will always contain the Key value)
- When only the Index or Item attribute is defined, the variable will always contain the Key value.

params.name: from
params.description: Beginning value of index.

params.name: to
params.description: Ending value of index.

params.name: step
params.description: Step by which to increment or decrement the index value.

params.name: condition
params.description: Condition that controls the loop.

params.name: query
params.description: Query that controls the loop. This can be a variable name or the query itself.

params.name: startrow
params.description: First row of query that is included in the loop.

params.name: endrow
params.description: Last row of query that is included in the loop. You cannot use this attribute together with the attribute maxRows.

params.name: maxrows
params.description: Specifies the maximum number of rows to display in the output section. You cannot use this attribute together with the attribute endrow.

params.name: list
params.description: A list, variable, or file name; contains a list. Used with the index attribute.

params.name: array
params.description: An array.

params.name: delimiters
params.description: Character(s) that separates items in list

params.name: collection
params.description: Collection to loop over. Used with the item attribute.

params.name: struct
params.description: struct to loop over

params.name: item
params.description: Key for the collection

params.name: file
params.description: file path

params.name: characters
params.description:
The number of characters to read during each iteration of the loop from the file specified in the file attribute.
If the value of the characters attribute is more than the number of characters in the file,
Lucee uses the number of characters in the file.

params.name: startline
params.description: start line

params.name: endline
params.description: end line

params.name: charset
params.description: charset for read the file

params.name: group
params.description:
Specifies the query column to use when you group sets of records together to send as an e-mail
message. For example, if you send a set of billing statements to customers, you might group on
"Customer_ID." The group attribute, which is case sensitive, eliminates adjacent duplicates when the
data is sorted by the specified field. See the Usage section for exceptions.

params.name: groupcasesensitive
params.description:
Boolean indicating whether to group with regard to case or not. The default value is NO;
case is considered while grouping. If the query attribute specifies a query object that was generated
by a case-insensitive SQL query, set the groupCaseSensitive attribute to NO to keep the recordset
intact.

params.name: label
params.description: used to address this loop from a "break" or "continue" statement (instead of the nearest one).

params.name: times
params.description: used for a simple loop that is looping n times
